metadata.Title: CVE-2018-18557 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
LibTIFF 3.9.3, 3.9.4, 3.9.5, 3.9.6, 3.9.7, 4.0.0alpha4, 4.0.0alpha5, 4.0.0alpha6, 4.0.0beta7, 4.0.0, 4.0.1, 4.0.2, 4.0.3, 4.0.4, 4.0.4beta, 4.0.5, 4.0.6, 4.0.7, 4.0.8 and 4.0.9 (with JBIG enabled) decodes arbitrarily-sized JBIG into a buffer, ignoring the buffer size, which leads to a tif_jbig.c JBIGDecode out-of-bounds write.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-18557` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libtiff-opengl - 4.0.3-7ubuntu0.10
libtiff-tools - 4.0.3-7ubuntu0.10
libtiff5 - 4.0.3-7ubuntu0.10
libtiffxx5 - 4.0.3-7ubuntu0.10
No subscription required

criterions.comment: tiff package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.0.3-7ubuntu0.10').
